location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Francis Warden's letter of 7 December 1820, which included a copy of the regulations that were passed on 23 October. According to Dow's letter, the regulations concern the matter of civil servants obtaining leave of absence from their stations, as well as the scale of allowances to be granted to civil servants who are on temporary appointments. Dow states that the regulations shall be duly attended to.
